title: Weather Discussion 3/22/24 | Weather Discussions | foxbangor.com
text:
Winter Storm Warnings are posted ahead of our next system which could bring significant snowfall to the region starting Saturday morning. Before we get any further, let's talk about today. We'll be partly cloudy and windy on this Friday with highs in the low 30s. Winds could gust up to 30 mph out of the west. Mostly cloudy tonight. Low temperatures will fall into the upper teens as the winds back off. The snow moves in Saturday. It could be heavy at times. Some rain could mix in late with highs in the mid 30s. A wintry mix rain, freezing rain, sleet and snow will be possible Saturday night as lows fall into the low 20s. Total snow accumulations will vary greatly depending on the transition line and temperatures. If you're near Millinocket or further north, expect up to 1 foot or even 1.5 feet of snow. Further south, the numbers drop off. Areas from Lincoln to Bangor could see 7-10 inches of snow. The snowfall amounts quickly drop off as you get closer to the coast. However, expect a lot of rain too 1-2 inches of rain could fall along the coast. Looking ahead, we're dry Sunday and Monday with a mostly cloudy sky and highs in the upper 30s. We're partly cloudy Tuesday with highs in the mid 40s. MAKE it a GREAT Friday and Weekend! Devin Biggs

Bangor 1 Weather Alert See All > Weather Alert ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SATURDAY TO 8 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 9 and 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Far Northern, North Woods, and Penobscot Valley Maine * WHEN...From 4 AM Saturday to 8 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult due to heavy snowfall and reduced visibility in areas of blowing snow. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel extremely dangerous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org. &&
